entries.name: FD_CLOEXEC
entries.desc:
FD_CLOEXEC
the value of the close-on-exec flag.

entries.name: F_DUPFD
entries.desc:
F_DUPFD
Duplicate a file descriptor to the minimum unused file descriptor greater
than or equal to the argument.
The close-on-exec flag of the duplicated file descriptor is set. (Ruby uses
F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC internally if available to avoid race condition.  F_SETFD is used if F_DUPFD_CLOEXEC is not
available.)

entries.name: F_GETFD
entries.desc:
F_GETFD
Read the close-on-exec flag of a file descriptor.

entries.name: F_GETFL
entries.desc:
F_GETFL
Get the file descriptor flags.  This will be one or more of the O_* flags.

entries.name: F_GETLK
entries.desc:
F_GETLK
Determine whether a given region of a file is locked.  This uses one of the
F_*LK flags.

entries.name: F_RDLCK
entries.desc:
F_RDLCK
Read lock for a region of a file

entries.name: F_SETFD
entries.desc:
F_SETFD
Set the close-on-exec flag of a file descriptor.

entries.name: F_SETFL
entries.desc:
F_SETFL
Set the file descriptor flags.  This will be one or more of the O_* flags.

entries.name: F_SETLK
entries.desc:
F_SETLK
Acquire a lock on a region of a file.  This uses one of the F_*LCK flags.

entries.name: F_SETLKW
entries.desc:
F_SETLKW
Acquire a lock on a region of a file, waiting if necessary.  This uses one
of the F_*LCK flags

entries.name: F_UNLCK
entries.desc:
F_UNLCK
Remove lock for a region of a file

entries.name: F_WRLCK
entries.desc:
F_WRLCK
Write lock for a region of a file

entries.name: O_ACCMODE
entries.desc:
O_ACCMODE
Mask to extract the read/write flags

entries.name: O_APPEND
entries.desc:
O_APPEND
Open the file in append mode

entries.name: O_CREAT
entries.desc:
O_CREAT
Create the file if it doesn't exist

entries.name: O_EXCL
entries.desc:
O_EXCL
Used with O_CREAT, fail if the file exists

entries.name: O_NDELAY
entries.desc:
O_NDELAY
Open the file in non-blocking mode

entries.name: O_NOCTTY
entries.desc:
O_NOCTTY
Open TTY without it becoming the controlling TTY

entries.name: O_NONBLOCK
entries.desc:
O_NONBLOCK
Open the file in non-blocking mode

entries.name: O_RDONLY
entries.desc:
O_RDONLY
Open the file in read-only mode

entries.name: O_RDWR
entries.desc:
O_RDWR
Open the file in read-write mode

entries.name: O_TRUNC
entries.desc:
O_TRUNC
Truncate the file on open

entries.name: O_WRONLY
entries.desc:
O_WRONLY
Open the file in write-only mode.
